title: Developing REST APIs with JAX-RS
description: This course introduces you to RESTful Web Services using the JAX-RS standard specification. You will learn what RESTful web services are and how to write them. You will write a sample RESTful web service from scratch, design the APIs, implement it using Jersey and run it on Tomcat.

title: Developing SOAP Web Services with JAX-WS
description: This course introduces you to SOAP Web Services using the JAX-WS standard specification. You will learn what SOAP web services are and how to write them. You will be writing a web service application, deploying, running and testing it on Glassfish. You will also learn to consume SOAP web services.

title: Learning Spring Core
description: This course provides an introduction to the Spring framework. You will understand the concepts of dependency injection, understand how the core Spring framework works and how to write an application using it.

title: Understanding Spring AOP
description: This course introduces the concepts of Aspect Oriented Programming and Spring AOP. You will learn to write Aspects in Java using Spring AOP and also understand the terminologies used in AOP along the way.

title: Data access in Spring
description: Almost every application needs to access data. In this course, you will learn about Spring support for data access from relational databases.

title: Introduction To Hibernate
description: This course provides an introduction to the Hibernate ORM framework. You will understand the concept of Object Relational Mapping (ORM). You will learn to use Hibernate to write Java applications that connect to a relational database. You will also learn various JPA annotations that let you map classes to relational models.

title: Hibernate - APIs and Runtime
description: This course explores the runtime aspects of Hibernate. You"ll understand how to perform Create, Read, Update and Delete operations, implement Hibernate APIs, understand the life cycle of entities, write queries in HQL, the Hibernate Query Language and implement caching.

title: Introduction to Maven
description: This course is an introduction to the basic features of Apache Maven. You will learn what Maven is and how it helps managing dependencies in your Java project. You will understand POM configuration, build phases and use plugins.

title: Beginning Struts 2
description: This course provides an introduction to the Struts 2 framework. You will understand the concepts of MVC, and learn to write a web application from scratch using Struts 2.

title: Introduction to Servlets
description: This course provides an introduction to Java Servlet technology. You will learn how to develop Java web applications using Servlets. you will also understand the life cycle of Servlets, how they work and how to configure them.

title: Java Server Pages
description: This course covers writing and implementing Java Server Pages (JSPs) on a servlet container. You will understand what JSPs are, how they are related to servlets and how to write view logic using them.

title: Advanced JAX-RS
description: This course covers more advanced concepts of JAX-RS. You will learn some important concepts related to resource life cycle, authentication and client APIs. You will also implement framework extensions like converters, message readers and writers.

title: JavaScript for Developers
description: This course is an introduction to the Javascript programming language. The course is meant for a developer new to JavaScript, but who is familiar with programming using some of the more traditional programming languages like C++ or Java.

title: Scopes and Closures In-depth
description: This course covers two important concepts of the JavaScript programming language - scopes and closures. In this course, you'll understand how variable scoping work in JavaScript. You'll also understand what closures are and how to use them in your code.

title: Thinking in AngularJS
description: This course is an introduction to the Javascript programming language. The course is meant for a developer new to JavaScript, but who is familiar with programming using some of the more traditional programming languages like C++ or Java.
